intro: Ayapanopsis cuchabensis, commonly known as the Cuchabén mountain plant, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its erect growth habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of red and pink. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
